column4: Hello, I am unable to update ubuntu from 9.10 to 10.04. I have tried few obvious options including mounting alternate CD ISO but of no use. Any help ?
the recommended way is via the network
but I dont get an option to upgrade when I use the update manager
look into system/adminstration/software sources -- updates tab: at the bottom there is "show new .. releases": does that show "normal" ?
yp
then try (from CLI) sudo do-release-upgrade
terminal says: checking for new ubuntu release No new release found
what does lsb_release -a show?
it says : No LSB modules are available.
you forgot the -a
no I have used the switch
no - my command shows http://paste.ubuntu.com/429694/
yes my output was the same. I thing I made a mistake that I pasted the output here in chat so it was printed as individual line. My output is exactly same to yours
next try: in CLI type sudo aptitude update, the try do do-release-upgrade again
the same output: no new release found. Here is my ubuntuforums thread: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1470077
one thing caught my eye: you are using "main server" -- that will be under heavy load still -- try to choose a mirror near your location
as you suggested earlier I tried to change mirror location but still I am unable to upgrade to 10.04
strange - I'm afraid I've run out of ideas -- obviously it must be some setting on your machine -- but I don't even know where apt keeps all of it's files...
can you please post your sources.list file in /etc/apt/
http://paste.ubuntu.com/429917/   -- a 9.10 system, where I get the option to upgrade
thanx
you're welcome :-)
